sub_title: Associate Professor & Head of RadioPharmaceutical Chemistry
summary: Consistent, yet flexible and a keen observer with a Doctorate in Radiopharmaceutical Sciences. Experience carries technical and practical involvement in a broad range of translational research projects on novel theranostics and multimodality molecular imaging probes (e.g. PET, SPECT, MRI, optical imaging). Gained exceptional skills and knowledge in chemistry and molecular imaging through rigorous training at the University of Paris XI, University of Sherbrooke and the University of California Los Angeles (UCLA). Harnessed in-depth knowledge of drug development, biomedical imaging, disease biology, pharmacology, organic chemistry, radiochemistry, radiopharmacy and cGMP. Proven Track record of implementing innovative solutions in a challenging and dynamic atmosphere (30+ peer-reviewed publications, 60+ scientific presentations at international conferences and about CHF 3,000,000 in grant funding).

awards.title: Leenaards Award
awards.description: For a project entitled: "A theranostic approach towards targeted chemotherapy delivery by RGD-conjugated cytotoxic compounds".

awards.title: Leenaards Award
awards.description: For a project entitled: "Noninvasive tumor angiogenesis imaging based on avb3 and a5b1 intern-targeted molecular probes with positron emission tomography".

profile_positions.title: Associate Professor & Head of RadioPharmaceutical Chemistry

profile_positions.description:
• Demonstrated scientific leadership and built up an innovative research program in line with the institution’s objectives and priorities on theranostics and targeted radionuclide therapy (2 FTEs).
• Supported institutional needs in radiopharmacy and radiopharmaceutical chemistry (2 FTEs). 
• Developed transversal collaboration with preclinical and clinical partners.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Professor & Head of Radiochemistry

profile_positions.description:
• Directed all functions and activities associated with the execution of an active research program supported by individual and collaborative peer-reviewed grant funding (3 FTEs).
• Swiftly rendered a lead role and a key interface for the division by providing input toward scientific goals, performance management and strategy. 
• Upheld superior level of expertise and supervised chemists for cGMP manufacture of radiopharmaceuticals for human use (2-3 FTEs).
• Integral participant in cross-functional collaboration with the BC Cancer Agency and Parkinson’s Research Centre.
profile_positions.title: Research Scientist & Deputy Associate Laboratory Director for the Life Sciences Division

profile_positions.description:
• Spearheaded a interdisciplinary scientist team (6-7 FTEs) and contributed to the success of strategic initiatives for the cyclotron unit (> 1.5 MCHF/year).
• Integral participant to research projects in oncology, neuroscience and cardiology resulting in over 1.9 MCHF in grant funding, 16 publications and 17 presentations.
• Strategically positioned as main point of contact with authorities and responsible for regulatory documents (i.e. IMPD, MAA).
• Managed cGMP production of radiopharmaceuticals for human and research applications.
profile_positions.title: Head of the Cyclotron Unit & Qualified Person

profile_positions.description:
• Presided over an independently-funded research program involving national and international collaborations and resulting in over 0.9 MCHF in grant funding, 5 publications and 25 presentations.
• Mentored students (2 PhD, 2 MSc) and postdoctoral fellows (2 FTEs); Teaching of radiochemistry, radiopharmacy and molecular imaging.
• Headed a small animal imaging laboratory team (1 FTE). Actively participated in the creation of the Institute of Translational Molecular Imaging (ITMI, 10 MCHF).
profile_positions.title: Assistant Professor & Head Of The MicroPET/SPECT/CT Imaging Lab

profile_positions.description:
• Demonstrated scientific research abilities and fundamental knowledge to synthesize novel radiopharmaceuticals.
• Scoped, spearheaded and implemented the microPET/SPECT/CT imaging laboratory. 
• Delivered competency-based instruction courses and supervised undergraduate and graduate students (1 PhD, 1 MSc).
profile_positions.title: Lecturer

profile_positions.description: • Synthesized tyrosine kinase inhibitors for lung cancer imaging and prediction of therapy (3 publications and 5 presentations).
profile_positions.title: Assistant Professor

profile_positions.description: • Synthesized and labeled chemotherapeutic agents for cancer treatment monitoring (2 publications and 2 presentations).
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Researcher
